prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. Begin by creating a new coordinate system: 1. **Coordinate System**: Set the Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.0312, 0.0]. Next, create a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system: 2. **Sketch**: On face 1, draw a loop with 4 lines. a. **First Line**: Start Point at [0.0, 0.0], End Point at [0.75, 0.0]. b. **Second Line**: Start Point at [0.75, 0.0], End Point at [0.75, 0.75]. c. **Third Line**: Start Point at [0.75, 0.75], End Point at [0.0, 0.75]. d. **Fourth Line**: Start Point at [0.0, 0.75], End Point at [0.0, 0.0]. Scale the sketch, then transform it into a 3D sketch, and subsequently extrude it to generate the 3D model: 3. **Extrusion**: a. Scale the sketch by 0.75. b. Extrude towards the normal by 0.0312, and keep the depth toward the opposite normal at 0. c. Set the sketch scale parameter to 0.75. Part 2: Cut-Out Section from the Top of the Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism Create a cut-out section from the top of the previously constructed three-dimensional rectangular prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system: 1. **Coordinate System**: Set the Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and Translation Vector to [0.125, 0.0, 0.1875]. Next, create a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system: 2. **Sketch**: On face 1, draw a loop with 4 lines. a. **First Line**: Start Point at [0.0, 0.0], End Point at [0.5, 0.0]. b. **Second Line**: Start Point at [0.5, 0.0], End Point at [0.5, 0.375]. c. **Third Line**: Start Point at [0.5, 0.375], End Point at [0.0, 0.375]. d. **Fourth Line**: Start Point at [0.0, 0.375], End Point at [0.0, 0.0]. Scale the sketch, then transform it into a 3D sketch, and subsequently perform the cut extrusion: 3. **Extrusion**: a. Scale the sketch by 0.5. b. Perform a cut extrusion of 0.0417 depth toward the opposite normal. c. Set the sketch scale parameter to 0.5. Dimensions: - Part 1 dimensions: + Length: 0.75 + Width: 0.0312 + Height: 0.0312 - Part 2 dimensions: + Length: 0.5 + Width: 0.0417 + Height: 0.5 From here, you can continue with the following parts, following the same instructions and incorporating a new coordinate system for each part.</description>
